title.narrative: Integrated Cash for Work & Productive Assets Rehabilitation/transfer in Support of Populations in Food Security Crisis in Mudug & Galgaduud Regions of Central Southern Somalia. SOM-09/A/23258/123

description.narrative:
4. 300 destitute pastoralist households (at least 50% women-headed households) will have received 12,000 healthy sheep and goats plus 600 pack camels to enable re-establishment of their pastoralist livelihoods. 5. Some 2,000 Bantu small-scale riverine farmers in Hiran region will have benefited from the sale of 400 MT of crop residues.
***Budget modification request received on 25 Jan 2010- approved by USG on 27 Jan 2010

participating-org.narrative: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO)

owner-org.narrative: UN OCHA Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

organisation.narrative: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)

mailing-address.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA), Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF), 2 United Nations Plaza (DC2), East 44th street (13th floor), United Nations, New York, USA

description.narrative: Disbursement to CERF Project Integrated Cash for Work & Productive Assets Rehabilitation/transfer in Support of Populations in Food Security Crisis in Mudug & Galgaduud Regions of Central Southern Somalia. SOM-09/A/23258/123

receiver-org.narrative: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO)

condition.narrative: CERF funding is based on an agreed proposal, including specific planned outcomes and outputs.
